intro: Oldenlandia contracta, commonly known as the small-leaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Oldenlandia contracta is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in partial to full shade.
